SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-631", "Win-Security-653","Win-Security-658", "Win-Security-663","Win-Security-4727", "Win-Security-4749","Win-Security-4754", "Win-Security-4759") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-2: Global Windows Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures global group modifications

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-641", "Win-Security-654","Win-Security-659", "Win-Security-664","Win-Security-4737", "Win-Security-4750","Win-Security-4755", "Win-Security-4760") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-2: Global Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures global group creations

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_38
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-631", "Win-Security-653","Win-Security-658", "Win-Security-663","Win-Security-4727", "Win-Security-4749","Win-Security-4754", "Win-Security-4759") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-2: Global Groups Deleted
Report.Description: This report captures global group deletions

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_39
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-634", "Win-Security-657","Win-Security-662", "Win-Security-667","Win-Security-4730", "Win-Security-4753","Win-Security-4758", "Win-Security-4763") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-2: Global Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures global group modifications

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-641", "Win-Security-654","Win-Security-659", "Win-Security-664","Win-Security-4737", "Win-Security-4750","Win-Security-4755", "Win-Security-4760") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-2: Local Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures local group creations

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_41
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-635", "Win-Security-648","Win-Security-4731", "Win-Security-4744") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Audited Linux file changes
Report.Description: Tracks user modifications to Linux files and directories. Both the content and attribute modifications are captured. For actions on directories, the affected files in the directories are also captured.

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Windows Domain Controller Config Changes
Report.Description: Provides detailed windows domain controller config changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_DC_20
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_ConfigChange) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Windows Server Config Modification Details
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server configuration or policy modification events. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_ConfigChange) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Windows File Access Failures
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access failures. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 1 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Windows File Access Successes
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access successes. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 0 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Successful Firewall Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about successful firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Failed Firewall Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about failed firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Successful Router Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about successful router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Failed Router Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about failed router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Successful VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all successful VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogoff) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Failed VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all failed VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Successful WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks successful admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Failed WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks failed admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Privileged Windows Server Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: This report details prvileged logon attempts to a windows server using the Administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_29
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Remote Desktop Connections to Windows Servers
Report.Description: This report details successful and failed remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Unix Server Privileged Logon
Report.Description: This report details UNIX server privileged logon (su) details with all parsed parameters and raw logs

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Unix Server Privileged Command Execution
Report.Description: This report details privilege command execuations (sudo) at a Unix server

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_9
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Detailed Successful Login At FISMA Device
Report.Description: Captures detailed successful logins at any device or application including servers, network devices, domain controllers, VPN gateways, WLAN controllers and applications

SubPattern.name: Filter_Auth_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DomainLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DomainLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_VPNLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_WirelessLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Windows Server Account Lock/Unlock history
Report.Description: Captures account lockouts and unlocks on windows servers. Account lockouts happen on repeated login failures and may be suspicious if they are repeated or happen at odd hours of operation.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_43
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostAccountLocked,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostAccountUnlocked) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Privileged Domain Controller Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers and their users by the number of failed logons using the administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_DC_32
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Remote Desktop Connections to Domain Controller
Report.Description: Details successful remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_DC_33
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AC-3: Successful Database Server Logon Details
Report.Description: Captures successful database server logons

Report.Name: FISMA CM-4: Failed Database Server Logon Details
Report.Description: Captures failed database server logons

Report.Name: FISMA CM-4: Firewall Configuration Changes
Report.Description: This report captures detected firewall configuration changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA CM-4: Router/Switch Configuration Changes
Report.Description: This report captures detected startup or running config changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA CM-4: Firewall Run vs Startup Configuration Change
Report.Description: This report captures detected differences between a firewall's running and startup config

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_35
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DELTA_CONFIG" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA CM-4: Router Run vs Startup Configuration Difference
Report.Description: This report captures detected differences between a routers running and startup config

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_35
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DELTA_CONFIG" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Outbound Permitted Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted outbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_20
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Inbound Permitted Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted inbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Permitted High Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks the high port services permitted by firewalls - these services may pose security risk

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_38
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Permitted Uncommon Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - common services include DNS, SMTP, Web

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_39
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort NOT IN (25,53,80,443,123) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Permitted Vulnerable Low Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - vulnerable services include Microsoft services such as MS-RPC (135), NETBIOS-SSN (139), MICROSOFT-DS (445), MS-SQL (1433,1434), FTP (23), TELNET (21)

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort IN (135,139,445,1433,1434,23,21) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Firewall Originated Or Destined Permitted Connections By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the firewall originated or destined connections - these connections would be typically be for administrative and monitoring purposes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND (srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) OR destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Network IPS events By Severity, Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network IPS events by count

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Network Scanners By Event Count
Report.Description: Ranks the source IP addresses by detected network scan or reconnaissance events

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Blocked Network Attacks By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network attacks blocked by network IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventAction = 1 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_15
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Filtered Inbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total inbound spam denied by spam filtering policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_17
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_18
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Filtered Outbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total outbound spam denied by policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Total Denied Web Connections By Policy
Report.Description: Counts denied web site connections because of policy violations

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Mail Security Gateway Actions By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the actions taken by the mail security gateway - actions include blocking an inbound/outbound mail gateway because of RBL or other SMTP violations, blocking a mail because of spam or other policy violations and delivering a mail

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_Remedy_Success,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top hosts with Malware found by Host Antivirus
Report.Description: Captures hosts with malware found by host anti-virus solutions

SubPattern.name: Filter_AV_5
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top IPs with Malware Found By IPS and Firewalls
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top IPs with Malware Found By Antivirus and Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Virus found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate the viruses found and remediated. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_1
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Worm_Remedy_Success) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Virus found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate viruses found but failed to remedy - the events could be from Host Anti-virus or Network Security Gateways. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Worm_Remedy_Failed) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Spyware found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Spyware_Remedy_Success) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Spyware found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software failed to remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Spyware_Remedy_Failed) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spam or mailicious mail attachments were found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software did not remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Phishing attempt found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate phishing attempt

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Host vulnerabilities found by scanners
Report.Description: This report details the host vulnerabilties found by scanners like Qyalys, Nessus, nCircle etc

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Blocked Inbound Connections By Count
Report.Description: Top Inbound Denied Connections Ranked By Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_28
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA SI-4: Top Blocked Outbound Connections By Count
Report.Description: Top Blocked Outbound Connections Ranked By Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_FISMA)

Report.Name: FISMA AU-6: All Monitoring System Admin User Logon Attempts
Report.Description: Details all Monitoring System Admin User Logon Attempts

Report.Name: FISMA IR-4: Top Security Incidents By Severity, Count
Report.Description: Ranks the security related incidents by first their severity and then by their count

Report.Name: Flow: Top Reporting Devices
Report.Description: This report ranks the reporting devices by flow count

Report.Name: Flow: Top Conversations By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the top connections by bytes

Report.Name: Flow: Top Source IPs By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the top source IPs by bytes

Report.Name: Flow: Top Destination IPs By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the top destination IPs by bytes

Report.Name: Flow: Top Protocols By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the top protocols by bytes

Report.Name: Flow: Top Interfaces By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the top device interfaces by bytes

Report.Name: Flow: Top Outbound Destination Countries By Bytes
Report.Description: This report ranks the outbound destination countries by bytes

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NetflowTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices By CPU
Report.Description: Ranks the FortiCare devices by average cpu utilization over a window

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices By Per CPU Util
Report.Description: Ranks the FortiCare devices by average per cpu utilization over a window

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices By Memory
Report.Description: Ranks the FortiCare devices by average memory utilization over a window

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices By Disk
Report.Description: Ranks the FortiCare devices by average disk utilization over a window

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks the FortiCare devices by average connections over a window

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Network Interfaces By Util
Report.Description: Ranks the Forticare devices and their network interfaces by first average inbound and then by outbound interface utilization. The utilization is computed by accounting for the link bandwidth.

SelectClause.AttrList: hostName "Host",intfName "Interface",AVG(inIntfUtil) "Recv Util",AVG(recvBitsPerSec) "Recv Bps",AVG(outIntfUtil) "Sent Util", AVG(sentBitsPerSec) "Sent Bps"

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices by Ping RTT
Report.Description: Tracks the PING response times and packet loss for the FortiCare devices

Report.Name: Top FortiCare Devices by SNMP RTT
Report.Description: Tracks the SNMP response times and packet loss for the monitored devices

Report.Name: FortiCare Device Power Supply Failures
Report.Description: Determines Forticare Devices By Power Supply Issues

Report.Name: FortiCare Device Temperature High
Report.Description: Determines Forticare Devices with high temperature

Report.Name: FortiCare Device Voltage Out Of Range
Report.Description: Determines Forticare Devices with voltage out of range

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Malware
Report.Description: This report captures malware detected by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiGate-antivirus-infected-file-detect" AND virusName IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Botnets
Report.Description: This report captures Botnets detected by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiGate-antivirus-botnet" AND virusName IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Top Country By Malware
Report.Description: This report ranks countries with malware found by FortiSandbox

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiSandbox-Malware-Detected" AND riskName NOT IN ("Clean", "Low Risk")

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Malware and Country
Report.Description: This report ranks countries with malware found by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN ("FortiGate-antivirus-infected-file-detect", "FortiGate-antivirus-botnet") AND destGeoCountry IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Total Analysis Jobs
Report.Description: This report counts FortiSandbox analysis jobs

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiSandbox-System" AND msg CONTAIN "Launching job for file"

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Zero Day Suspicious URLs
Report.Description: This report captures suspicious URLs found by FortiSandbox

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiSandbox-Malware-Detected" AND riskName NOT IN ("Malicious", "Clean", "Low Risk") AND fileName = "N/A"

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Zero Day Suspicious Files
Report.Description: This report captures suspicious files found by FortiSandbox

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiSandbox-Malware-Detected" AND riskName NOT IN ("Malicious", "Clean", "Low Risk") AND fileName = "N/A"

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Zero Day Malicious URLs
Report.Description: This report captures malicious URLs found by FortiSandbox

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Zero Day Malicious Files
Report.Description: This report captures malicious files found by FortiSandbox

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Applications by Bandwidth
Report.Description: This report ranks applications by bandwidth usage as reported by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType CONTAIN "FortiGate-traffic" AND appName IS NOT NULL AND appGroupName IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Web Sites by Bandwidth
Report.Description: This report ranks web sites by bandwidth usage as reported by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiGate-webfilter-url-firewall-allow" AND hostName IS NOT NULL AND webCategory IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Web Sites by Connections
Report.Description: This report ranks web sites by connections as reported by FortiGate

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiGate-webfilter-url-firewall-allow" AND hostName IS NOT NULL AND webCategory IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Sources by Bandwidth
Report.Description: This report ranks source IP addresses by bandwidth as reported by FortiGate

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Destinations by Bandwidth
Report.Description: This report ranks destination IP addresses by bandwidth as reported by FortiGate

Report.Description: This report ranks IPS attacks detected by FortiGate

Report.Name: FortiGate Top Malicious Websites
Report.Description: This report captures malicious websites detected by FortiGate

Report.Name: FortiGate Top IPS Quarantined Hosts
Report.Description: This report captures hosts quarantined by FortiGate

Report.Name: GLBA 1.6.1: Top Reporting Modules Ranked By Event Rate
Report.Description: Ranks the reporting devices by events per second. This report shows the breadth of the devices from where security logs are collected.

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_STATUS
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: phEventCategory = 3 AND eventType = "PH_SYSTEM_DEVAPP_EVENTS_PER_SEC" AND eventType NOT CONTAIN "PH_DEV_MON"

Report.Name: GLBA 1.6.4: Top Security Incidents By Severity, Count
Report.Description: Ranks the security related incidents by first their severity and then by their count

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Firewall Configuration Changes
Report.Description: This report captures detected firewall configuration changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Router/Switch Configuration Changes
Report.Description: This report captures detected startup or running config changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Firewall Run vs Startup Configuration Change
Report.Description: This report captures detected differences between a firewall's running and startup config

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_35
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DELTA_CONFIG" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Router Run vs Startup Configuration Difference
Report.Description: This report captures detected differences between a routers running and startup config

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_35
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DELTA_CONFIG" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7,2.C.9: Audited Linux file changes
Report.Description: Tracks user modifications to Linux files and directories. Both the content and attribute modifications are captured. For actions on directories, the affected files in the directories are also captured.

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Windows Domain Controller Config Changes
Report.Description: Provides detailed windows domain controller config changes

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7: Windows Server Config Modification Details
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server configuration or policy modification events. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_ConfigChange)

Report.Name: GLBA 1.7.7,2.C.9: Windows File Access Failures
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access failures. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 1 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Successful Firewall Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about successful firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Failed Firewall Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about failed firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Successful Router Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about successful router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Failed Router Admin Logons
Report.Description: Details about failed router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4,2.B.17: Successful VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all successful VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogoff) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4,2.B.17: Failed VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all failed VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4,2.B.17: Successful WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks successful admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4,2.B.17: Failed WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks failed admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Privileged Windows Server Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: This report details prvileged logon attempts to a windows server using the Administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_29
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Remote Desktop Connections to Windows Servers
Report.Description: This report details successful and failed remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Unix Server Privileged Logon
Report.Description: This report details UNIX server privileged logon (su) details with all parsed parameters and raw logs

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Unix Server Privileged Command Execution
Report.Description: This report details privilege command execuations (sudo) at a Unix server

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_9
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Detailed Successful Login At GLBA Device
Report.Description: Captures detailed successful logins at any device or application including servers, network devices, domain controllers, VPN gateways, WLAN controllers and applications

SubPattern.name: Filter_Auth_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DomainLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DomainLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_VPNLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_WirelessLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Privileged Domain Controller Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers and their users by the number of failed logons using the administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_DC_32
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.4: Remote Desktop Connections to Domain Controller
Report.Description: Details successful remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_DC_33
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Windows Server Account Lock/Unlock history
Report.Description: Captures account lockouts and unlocks on windows servers. Account lockouts happen on repeated login failures and may be suspicious if they are repeated or happen at odd hours of operation.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_43
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostAccountLocked,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostAccountUnlocked) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Local Windows User Accounts Created
Report.Description: This report captures user accounts added on a server

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_26
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-624","Win-Security-4720") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Local Windows User Accounts Modified
Report.Description: This report captures local user account modifications.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_28
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_GroupChanged,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountChanged) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Local Windows User Accounts Deleted
Report.Description: This report captures user accounts removed from a server

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_27
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-630","Win-Security-4726")

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Users Added To Local Groups
Report.Description: This report captures users added to local groups.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_32
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-636", "Win-Security-650","Win-Security-4732","Win-Security-4746") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Users Added To Global Groups
Report.Description: This report captures users added to global or univeral groups.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_33
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-632", "Win-Security-655","Win-Security-660", "Win-Security-665", "Win-Security-4728", "Win-Security-4751","Win-Security-4756", "Win-Security-4761") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Local Windows Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures local group modifications

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_37
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-639", "Win-Security-649","Win-Security-4735", "Win-Security-4745") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Local Windows Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures local group creations

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_41
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-635", "Win-Security-648","Win-Security-4731", "Win-Security-4744") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Global Windows Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures global group creations

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_38
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-631", "Win-Security-653","Win-Security-658", "Win-Security-663","Win-Security-4727", "Win-Security-4749","Win-Security-4754", "Win-Security-4759") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.A.2: Global Windows Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures global group modifications

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-641", "Win-Security-654","Win-Security-659", "Win-Security-664","Win-Security-4737", "Win-Security-4750","Win-Security-4755", "Win-Security-4760") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Outbound Permitted Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted outbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_20
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Inbound Permitted Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted inbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Permitted High Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks the high port services permitted by firewalls - these services may pose security risk

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_38
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Permitted Uncommon Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - common services include DNS, SMTP, Web

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_39
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort NOT IN (25,53,80,443,123)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Permitted Vulnerable Low Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - vulnerable services include Microsoft services such as MS-RPC (135), NETBIOS-SSN (139), MICROSOFT-DS (445), MS-SQL (1433,1434), FTP (23), TELNET (21)

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort IN (135,139,445,1433,1434,23,21) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Firewall Originated Or Destined Permitted Connections By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the firewall originated or destined connections - these connections would be typically be for administrative and monitoring purposes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND (srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) OR destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12: Top Network IPS events By Severity, Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network IPS events by count

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Network Scanners By Event Count
Report.Description: Ranks the source IP addresses by detected network scan or reconnaissance events

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Blocked Network Attacks By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network attacks blocked by network IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventAction = 1 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_15
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Filtered Inbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total inbound spam denied by spam filtering policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_17
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_18
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Filtered Outbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total outbound spam denied by policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12: Total Denied Web Connections By Policy
Report.Description: Counts denied web site connections because of policy violations

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12: Top Mail Security Gateway Actions By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the actions taken by the mail security gateway - actions include blocking an inbound/outbound mail gateway because of RBL or other SMTP violations, blocking a mail because of spam or other policy violations and delivering a mail

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.8: Top hosts with Malware found by Host Antivirus
Report.Description: Captures hosts with malware found by host anti-virus solutions

SubPattern.name: Filter_AV_5
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.8: Top IPs with Malware Found By IPS and Firewalls
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.8: Top IPs with Malware Found By Antivirus and Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.8: Non-compliant Hosts and Security Software License Expirations
Report.Description: Tracks non-compliant hosts and license expiry events from Security Management Gateways and Firewalls. Non-compliant hosts may not have proper security software running and therefore may pose a security threat. License expiration of security software may expose exploitable security vulnerabilities.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_LicenseExpired,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NoncompliantHost) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.17: Windows File Access Successes
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access successes. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 0 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_GLBA)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.C.17: Windows Audit Policy Changes
Report.Description: This report captures audit policy changes

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Virus found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate the viruses found and remediated. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Virus found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate viruses found but failed to remedy - the events could be from Host Anti-virus or Network Security Gateways. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Spyware found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Spyware found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software failed to remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spam or mailicious mail attachments were found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software did not remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Phishing attempt found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate phishing attempt

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.9: Host vulnerabilities found by scanners
Report.Description: This report details the host vulnerabilties found by scanners like Qyalys, Nessus, nCircle etc

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Blocked Inbound Connections By Count
Report.Description: Top Inbound Denied Connections Ranked By Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_28
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.B.12,2.M.9: Top Blocked Outbound Connections By Count
Report.Description: Top Blocked Outbound Connections Ranked By Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

Report.Name: GLBA 2.M.6: All Monitoring System Admin User Logon Attempts
Report.Description: Details all Monitoring System Admin User Logon Attempts
