Report.Description: Tracks password changes

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PasswordChange) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Privileged Windows Server Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: This report details prvileged logon attempts to a windows server using the Administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_29
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Remote Desktop Connections to Windows Servers
Report.Description: This report details successful and failed remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Unix Server Privileged Logon
Report.Description: This report details UNIX server privileged logon (su) details with all parsed parameters and raw logs

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Unix Server Privileged Command Execution
Report.Description: This report details privilege command execuations (sudo) at a Unix server

SubPattern.name: Filter_UNIX_9
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND (eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecSuccess) OR eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivExecFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Successful Firewall Admin Logon Details
Report.Description: Details about successful firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Failed Firewall Admin Logon Details
Report.Description: Details about failed firewall logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Successful Router Admin Logon Details
Report.Description: Details about successful router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Failed Router Admin Logon Details
Report.Description: Details about failed router logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_Router_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Successful VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all successful VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogoff) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Failed VPN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Provides event details for all failed VPN admin logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Successful WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks successful admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.5,PCI1.x): Failed WLAN Admin Logon
Report.Description: Tracks failed admin logons to the WLAN Controller

SubPattern.name: Filter_WLAN_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WLAN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.6): Security Incidents
Report.Description: Captures the security related incidents

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_STATUS
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: phEventCategory = 1 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PH_RULE_SEC) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Virus found but not remediated by Host Antivirus
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate the viruses that Host Antivirus found but failed to remedy

SubPattern.name: Filter_AV_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Worm_Remedy_Failed) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Spyware found but not remediated by Host Antivirus
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate Spyware found on a device Host Anti-virus solutions failed to remedy

SubPattern.name: Filter_AV_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Spyware_Remedy_Failed) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Top Hosts with Malware found by Host Antivirus
Report.Description: Captures hosts with malware found by host anti-virus solutions

SubPattern.name: Filter_AV_5
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Top Hosts with Malware Found By Network IPS and Firewalls
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Top Hosts with Malware Found By Antivirus and Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.9): Non-compliant Hosts and Security Software License Expirations
Report.Description: Tracks non-compliant hosts and license expiry events from Security Management Gateways and Firewalls. Non-compliant hosts may not have proper security software running and therefore may pose a security threat. License expiration of security software may expose exploitable security vulnerabilities.

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_LicenseExpired,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NoncompliantHost) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewalls and Permitted Outbound Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted outbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_20
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_PCI) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewalls and Permitted Inbound Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks firewalls and permitted inbound services by first the total number of connections and then by bytes for that service

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_PCI) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewalls and Permitted High Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks the high port services permitted by firewalls - these services may pose security risk

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_38
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_PCI) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewalls and Permitted Uncommon Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - common services include DNS, SMTP, Web

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_39
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort NOT IN (25,53,80,443,123) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewalls and Permitted Vulnerable Low Port Services By Connections, Bytes
Report.Description: Tracks uncommon services permitted by firewalls - vulnerable services include Microsoft services such as MS-RPC (135), NETBIOS-SSN (139), MICROSOFT-DS (445), MS-SQL (1433,1434), FTP (23), TELNET (21)

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_40
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND destIpPort IN (135,139,445,1433,1434,23,21) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_PCI) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Firewall Originated Or Destined Permitted Connections By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the firewall originated or destined connections - these connections would be typically be for administrative and monitoring purposes

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND (srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) OR destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL)) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_PCI) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Blocked Internal Sources, Services, Destinations
Report.Description: Ranks blocked Internal Sources, Services, Destinations Ranked By Connection Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Blocked Internal Destinations, Services Ranked By Connection Count
Report.Description: Ranks blocked Internal Destinations, Services Ranked By Connection Count

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_15
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND destIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Network IPS events By Severity, Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network IPS events by count

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Network Scanners By Event Count
Report.Description: Ranks the source IP addresses by detected network scan or reconnaissance events

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Blocked Network Attacks By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the network attacks blocked by network IPS

SubPattern.name: Filter_NIPS_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventAction = 1 AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Web Users By Uncommon HTTP Method Connections
Report.Description: Ranks web users by uncommon HTTP methods used

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND httpMethod NOT IN ("GET", "POST") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Web Users By HTTP POST Exchanged Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks web clients by HTTP POST byte count - can catch malware sending confidential information out

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND httpStatusCode IN ("200") AND httpMethod = "POST" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Visited Web Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks (successfully) visited web sites and categories by the number of connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Denied Web Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks web sites and categories that were denied by policy, by the number of connections

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Web Users, Denied Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks users, web sites and categories that were denied by policy, by the number of connections

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Inbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_15
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Filtered Inbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total inbound spam denied by spam filtering policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways by the number of attempted SMTP connections. The most common reason of denial is often the gateway being included in blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_17
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Outbound Blacklisted Mail Gateways and SMTP Error Types By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks denied mail gateways and the SMTP errors by the number of attempted connections. The most common SMTP error is often the gateway being included in mail blacklists.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_18
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Filtered Outbound Spam Count
Report.Description: Counts total outbound spam denied by policy

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_16
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Total Denied Web Connections By Policy
Report.Description: Counts denied web site connections because of policy violations

Report.Name: SOX (DS5.10): Top Mail Security Gateway Actions By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the actions taken by the mail security gateway - actions include blocking an inbound/outbound mail gateway because of RBL or other SMTP violations, blocking a mail because of spam or other policy violations and delivering a mail

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_GwBlocked,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_MailMalware_Remedy_Success,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS9.x): Firewall Config Changes Detected Via Login
Report.Description: This report captures detected startup or running config changes - the changes are detected by logging into the device and hence is accurate.

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS9.x): Firewall Run vs Startup Config Difference Via Login
Report.Description: This report captures detected differences between a routers running and startup config

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_35
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DELTA_CONFIG" AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: SOX (DS9.x): Router/Switch Config Changes Detected Via Login
Report.Description: This report captures detected startup or running config changes - the changes are detected by logging into the device and hence is accurate.

SubPattern.name: Filter_FW_36
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND eventType IN ("PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_RUN_CONFIG","PH_DEV_MON_CHANGE_STARTUP_CONFIG") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (BizService@PH_SYS_BizSrvc_SOX)

Report.Name: Top Reporting Storage Devices
Report.Description: Ranks reporting storage systems by event count

Report.Name: Top Reporting Storage Device Event Types By Count
Report.Description: Ranks reporting storage systems event types by count

Report.Name: Top Storage Devices By CPU Util
Report.Description: Ranks the storage devices by average cpu utilization over a window

Report.Name: Top NetApp Filers By CPU Util
Report.Description: Ranks NetApp Filers by average cpu utilization over a window

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_CPU_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND reptVendor = "NetApp" AND reptModel = "DataONTAP"

Report.Name: Top NetApp Filers
Report.Description: Ranks the storage devices by disk activity and presents other metrics

Report.Name: Top NetApp storage devices by errors
Report.Description: Ranks the storage devices by NFS protocol level errors

Report.Name: Top NetApp Devices By Disk Space Util
Report.Description: Ranks the NetApp Storage devices by average system disk utilization over a window

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND reptVendor = "NetApp"

Report.Name: Top NetApp Devices By Disk Space Util (Detailed)
Report.Description: Ranks the NetApp Storage devices by average system disk utilization over a window.Provides additional details such as total, used and free disk spaces

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND reptVendor = "NetApp"

Report.Name: Top NetApp Devices By Disk Space Growth
Report.Description: Ranks the NetApp Storage devices by average daily disk space growth

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_TREND_DAY" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND reptVendor = "NetApp"

Report.Name: NetApp Devices By Least Days To Disk Full
Report.Description: Ranks the NetApp Storage devices by the estimated days before the disk will become full

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_TREND_DAY" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND reptVendor = "NetApp"

Report.Name: Storage Hardware Errors
Report.Description: Captures Storage hardware warning or critical errors. Includes both NetApp and EMC Clariion.

Report.Name: NetApp Hardware Status
Report.Description: Captures NetApp hardware status

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage) AND eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_HW_STATUS" AND reptVendor = "NetApp"

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Processors By CPU, I/O (Detailed)
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX Storage processors by cpu and then I/O

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Ports By IOPS
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX Storage ports by I/O operations/sec

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Ports By I/O Volume
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX Storage ports by I/O volume

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX LUNs By I/O Activity (Detailed)
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX LUNs by I/O Activity

Report.Name: Top Server to Clariion/VNX LUNs By I/O Activity (Detailed)
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX LUNs by I/O Activity

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Pools By I/O Activity (Detailed)
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX Storage Pools by I/O Activity - IOPS and throughput

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Ports By Total I/O Mbps
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage ports by total read + write I/O Mbps

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Processors By CPU
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage processors by cpu

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Processors By I/O Mbps
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage processors by I/O Mbps

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Ports By I/O operations/sec
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage ports by I/O operations/sec

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage LUNs By I/O Mbps
Report.Description: Ranks the Storage LUNs By I/O Mbps

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage LUNs By I/O Operations/sec
Report.Description: Ranks Clariion/VNX LUNs by I/O Operations/sec

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Pools By I/O Throughput
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage Pools by I/O throughput

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Pools By I/O Operations/sec
Report.Description: Ranks the Clariion/VNX Storage Pools by I/O Operations/sec

Report.Name: Top Clariion/VNX Storage Pools By Capacity Utilization

SelectClause.AttrList: hostName,memName, AVG(memUtil), AVG(freeMemKB), AVG(bufMemKB), AVG(cacheMemKB), AVG(swapInRate), AVG(swapOutRate),AVG(swapRate)

Report.Name: Availability: Unix Server Down/Restart
Report.Description: Tracks server down and restart events

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_AVAIL_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_SystemShutdown,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_SystemRestart) AND (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) OR hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER))

Report.Name: Availability: Unix Application Down/Restart
Report.Description: Tracks application stop and start events

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_AVAIL_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppShutdown,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppRestart) AND (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) OR hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER))

Report.Name: Availability: Unix Server Interface Down/Up
Report.Description: Tracks server network interface down and up events

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_AVAIL_7
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NetIntfShutdown,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NetIntfRestart) AND (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) OR hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER))

Report.Name: Availability: Top Unix Servers by Uptime
Report.Description: Ranks the unix servers by system uptime

Report.Name: Availability: Top Unix Applications By synthetic transaction monitoring Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks the services by average synthetic transaction monitoring probe response times.

Report.Name: Availability: Unix Server TCP/UDP Ports Up/Down
Report.Description: Tracks TCP/UDP ports that went up or down in a server

Report.Name: Availability: Unix Server Processes Started/Stopped
Report.Description: Tracks started/stopped server processes

Report.Name: Change: Audited Linux file changes
Report.Description: Tracks user modifications to Linux files and directories. Both the content and attribute modifications are captured. For actions on directories, the affected files in the directories are also captured.

Report.Name: Top Unix Network Interfaces By 95th Pctile Traffic
Report.Description: Ranks the windows network interfaces by 95th percentile traffic

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

Report.Name: Top Unix Applications By CPU, Memory
Report.Description: Ranks Windows processes by first average cpu utilization and then by memory utilization

Report.Name: Unix Servers By Least Free Disk Space
Report.Description: Ranks windows servers by minimum free disk space over a window

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot") AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER)

Report.Name: Change: Unix Server Software Update
Report.Description: Tracks software updates by something like yum update

Report.Name: Linux SNMP DskTable Not Configured At All
Report.Description: Reports Linux servers where SNMP diskTable is not configured. Monitoring disk space usage via SNMP diskTable provides a proper accounting for (typically 5pct) reserved space in Linux filesystems. It is recommended to configure SNMP disktable on all linux systems for all disks.

Report.Name: Linux SNMP DskTable Not Configured For Specific Disk
Report.Description: Reports Linux servers where SNMP dskTable is generally configured, but not for all disks. Monitoring disk space usage via SNMP diskTable provides a proper accounting for (typically 5pct) reserved space in Linux filesystems. It is recommended to configure SNMP disktable on all linux systems for all disks.

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DISCOV_LINUX_DSKTABLE_NOT_CONFIG" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_UNIX_SERVER) AND diskName IS NOT NULL

Report.Description: This report ranks virtual machines by swapping activity

Report.Description: This report ranks virtual machines by consumed memory and provides other memory management details

Report.Name: Top VMs By Ballooning Memory
Report.Description: This report ranks virtual machines by balooning memory size. Excessive balooning may indicate that a VM has been allocated too much memory and ESX is allocating unused memory to other VMs.

Report.Description: This report ranks virtual machines by disk I/O activity. Other disk I/O usage metrics are included.

Report.Description: This report ranks ESX hosts by aggregate cpu utilization. Other CPU usage metrics are included.

Report.Description: This report ranks ESX hosts by memory utilization.

Report.Description: This report identifies ESX hosts with low enough free memory so that ESX is using memory balooning technique for memory management

SubPattern.name: Filter_VMware_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VM_SERVER) AND (freeMemState IN (2,3))

SubPattern.name: Filter_VMware_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VM_SERVER) AND (freeMemState IN (1,2))

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top VPN Users Ranked By Successful VPN Logon
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN users by the number of successful VPN logons

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top VPN Users Ranked By Failed VPN Logon
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN users by the number of failed VPN logons. While some amount of failed login is normal, an unusually high number specifically at odd times of the day may be suspicious

Report.Name: Traffic: Top VPN Gateways, Users Ranked By Session Count, Average Bytes Exchanged, Average Session Duration
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways and their users by the total amount ofexchanged bytes. This report provides further insight into the top VPN users from a bytes transferred perspective

Report.Name: Traffic: Top VPN Gateways, Users Ranked By Average Bytes Exchanged Per Connection
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways and their users by the average exchanged bytes per VPN connection

Report.Name: Traffic: Top VPN Gateways, Users Ranked By Duration, Session Count
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways and users by average VPN session duration

Report.Name: Admin Logon: Top VPN Gateways, Admin Users Ranked By Successful Logon
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways and their admin users by the number of successful device logons

SubPattern.name: Filter_VPNGW_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_VPN_GATEWAY) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)

Report.Name: Admin Logon: Top VPN Gateways, Admin Users Ranked By Failed Logon

Report.Name: Admin Logon: VPN Admin Logon/Logoff Activity Details

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top VPN Gateways Ranked By Distinct Successfully Logged on Users
Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways by the total number of distinct user logons

Report.Name: VPN Logon: VPN User Logon/Logoff Detailed View
Report.Description: Captures detailed successful and failed VPN logons and logoffs

Report.Name: Admin Logon: Successful VPN Admin Logon Detailed View
Report.Description: Provides event details for all successful VPN admin logons

Report.Name: Admin Logon: Failed VPN Admin Logon Detailed View
Report.Description: Provides event details for all failed VPN admin logons

Report.Description: Ranks the VPN Gateways by the total number of logons

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top IPSec VPN P1 Tunnels Ranked By Traffic
Report.Description: Ranks the IPSec VPN P1 tunnels by traffic. Works only for Cisco IPSec VPN tunnels implementing IPSec FLOW MIB

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top IPSec VPN P2 Tunnels Ranked By Traffic
Report.Description: Ranks the IPSec VPN P2 tunnels by traffic. Works only for Cisco IPSec VPN tunnels implementing IPSec FLOW MIB

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top Remote Access VPN Users Ranked By Traffic
Report.Description: Ranks the IPSec VPN P2 tunnels by traffic. Works only for Cisco IPSec VPN tunnels implementing IPSec FLOW MIB

Report.Name: VPN Logon: Top Remote Access VPN Users Ranked By Session Duration
Report.Description: Ranks the IPSec VPN P2 tunnels by traffic. Works only for Cisco IPSec VPN tunnels implementing IPSec FLOW MIB

Report.Name: Virus found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate the viruses found and remediated. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: Virus found but not remediated (Detailed)
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate viruses found but failed to remedy - the events could be from Host Anti-virus or Network Security Gateways. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: Virus found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate viruses found but failed to remedy - the events could be from Host Anti-virus or Network Security Gateways. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: Spyware found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: Spyware found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software failed to remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle etc.

Report.Name: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spam or mailicious mail attachments were found and remediated on a host. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found but not remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate spyware was found but the detecting software did not remediated the vulnerability. This report is applicable for host antivirus, security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Untangle, Websense Mail gateway, Ironport Mail Gateway etc.

Report.Name: Phishing attempt found and remediated
Report.Description: Captures events that indicate phishing attempt

Report.Name: Top IPs with Malware Found By Antivirus and Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

Report.Name: Top Computers with Malware Found By Antivirus and Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks computers with Malware as found by Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

Report.Name: Top IPs with Malware Found By IPS and Firewalls
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by IPS - these are somewhat less reliable than Host Anti-virus and Security Gateways

Report.Name: Top IPs with Malware Found By Security Gateways
Report.Description: Tracks IP addresses with Malware as found by Security Gateways

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware) AND reptDevIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_MGMT)

Report.Name: Non-compliant Hosts and Security Software License Expirations
Report.Description: Tracks non-compliant hosts and license expiry events from Security Management Gateways and Firewalls. Non-compliant hosts may not have proper security software running and therefore may pose a security threat. License expiration of security software may expose exploitable security vulnerabilities.

Report.Name: Host vulnerabilities found by scanners
Report.Description: This report details the host vulnerabilties found by scanners like Qualys, Nessus, nCircle, McAfee etc

Report.Name: Top Hosts with Vulnerabilities found by scanners
Report.Description: Ranks the hosts by vulnerabilities found by scanners

Report.Name: Host vulnerability found by scanners with details
Report.Description: Details the vulnerabilities discovered on hosts

Report.Name: Top OS types with vulnerabilities
Report.Description: Ranks OS types by vulnerabilities found

Report.Name: FortiSandbox found file malware
Report.Description: Ranks FortiSandbox found file malware by count

Report.Name: FortiSandbox found network intrusions
Report.Description: Ranks FortiSandbox found network intrusions (attacks, malware URLs and botnets) by count

Report.Name: FortiSandbox system logs
Report.Description: Captures FortiSandbox system logs

Report.Name: FortiSandbox Zero Day E-Mail
Report.Description: Captures FortiSandbox detected email virus

SubPattern.name: Filter_Vuln_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "FortiSandbox-Malware-Detected" AND user CONTAIN "@" AND riskName != "Clean"

Report.Description: Ranks Riverbed appliances and top TCP/UDP ports by bytes

Report.Description: Ranks Visited Web Sites By Connections

Report.Description: Ranks Client Web Browser types

Report.Name: Top Web Users By Uncommon HTTP Method Connections
Report.Description: Ranks web users by uncommon HTTP methods used

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND httpMethod NOT IN ("GET", "POST")

Report.Name: Top Web Users By HTTP POST Count
Report.Description: Ranks web users by HTTP POST count - can catch malware sending confidential information out

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_9
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND httpStatusCode IN ("200") AND httpMethod = "POST"

Report.Name: Top Web Users By HTTP POST Exchanged Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks web clients by HTTP POST byte count - can catch malware sending confidential information out

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_SEC_GW) AND httpStatusCode IN ("200") AND httpMethod = "POST"

Report.Name: Top Visited Web Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks (successfully) visited web sites and categories by the number of connections

Report.Name: Top Denied Web Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks web sites and categories that were denied by policy, by the number of connections

Report.Name: Top Web Users, Denied Sites And Categories By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks users, web sites and categories that were denied by policy, by the number of connections

Report.Name: Total Denied Web Connections By Policy
Report.Description: Counts denied web site connections because of policy violations

Report.Name: Top Reporting Security Gateways By Event Count
Report.Description: Ranks the security gateways by the number of events

Report.Name: Top User Web Activity By Connections
Report.Description: Ranks the users, successfully visited web sites and categories by the number of connections. This report is applicable for security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do web traffic content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Bluecoat, Squid etc.

Report.Name: Detailed User Web Activity
Report.Description: Details user web activity. This report is applicable for security gateways, proxies and firewalls that do web traffic content inspection e.g. Palo Alto Firewall, Bluecoat, Squid etc.

Report.Name: Bluecoat client to proxy metrics
Report.Description: Details Bluecoat client to proxy requests, transferred bytes/sec, cache hits, errors

SelectClause.AttrList: reptDevIpAddr, AVG(client2ProxyHttpReq), AVG(client2ProxyHttpKBps), AVG(proxy2ClientHttpKBps), AVG(client2ProxyHttpCacheHit), AVG(client2ProxyHttpError)

Report.Name: Bluecoat proxy to server metrics
Report.Description: Details Bluecoat proxy to server requests, errors, transferred bytes/sec

SelectClause.AttrList: reptDevIpAddr, AVG(proxy2ServerHttpReq), AVG(proxy2ServerHttpKBps), AVG(server2ProxyHttpKBps), AVG(proxy2ServerHttpErr), AVG(proxyCacheObjCount)

Report.Name: Blocked Medium/High Threat Level Web Conections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_WebsiteCategoryViolation) AND threatLevel IN ("medium","high") AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW)

Report.Name: Top Blocked Outbound Web Conections Sources
FortiWeb Configuration Changes
FortiWeb System and Analysis Engine Upgrade Activity
FortiWeb Account/Group Modification Activity

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountCreated, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountChanged, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountDeleted,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountGrpChange) AND eventType CONTAIN "FortiWeb"

Report.Name: FortiWeb System Restart Activity
Report.Description: This report captures FortiWeb restart activity

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_PROXY_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_SystemShutdown, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_SystemRestart) AND eventType CONTAIN "FortiWeb"

Report.Name: FortiWeb Successful Admin Logon
FortiWeb Failed Admin Logon
FortiWeb Operational Errors
Top Web Servers By hits, distinct visitors and bandwidth
Report.Description: Ranks Web servers by first the number of hits, then by the number of distinct visitors and used bandwidth

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_1
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers and URLs By hits
Report.Description: Ranks Web Servers, URLs by the number of hits

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_2
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers and URLs By Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks Web Servers, URLs by response time, that is, by the maximum time taken to serve the request)

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Downloaded URLs By Hits and Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks FTP downloaded files by the number of hits and then by the number of sent bytes

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_4
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "sent"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Downloaded URLs By Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks FTP downloaded files by the number of sent bytes

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_5
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "sent"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Downloaded URLs By Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks FTP downloaded files by the response time, that is, by the time taken to serve the request

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "sent"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Uploaded URLs By Hits and Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks servers and FTP uploaded files by the number of hits, then by bytes

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_7
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "created"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Uploaded URLs By Bytes
Report.Description: Ranks servers and FTP uploaded files by the number of bytes uploaded

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "created"

Report.Name: Top FTP Servers and Uploaded URLs By Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks servers and FTP uploads by the response time, i.e. time taken to serve the request

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_9
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic) AND ftpMethod CONTAIN "created"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers and their Entry Points By Hits
Report.Description: Ranks Web Server Entry points by the number of hits

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_10
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpReferrer IS NULL

Report.Name: Top Web Servers, URLs and Referrers By Hits
Report.Description: Ranks Web Servers and their Referrers by the number of hits

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_11
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpReferrer IS NOT NULL

Report.Name: Top Web Server Bandwidth Usage By Service
Report.Description: Ranks web Servers and destination ports by the total bandwidth used

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Visitors By Server Side Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks the web visitors by the number of HTTP server side error count

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_13
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("IIS-Web-Server-Error", "Apache-Web-Server-Error")

Report.Name: Top Web Visitors By Client Side Errors
Report.Description: Ranks the web visitors by the number of HTTP client side error count

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_14
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("IIS-Web-Client-Error", "Apache-Web-Client-Error")

Report.Name: Top Web Server Errors By Count
Report.Description: Ranks the server side errors by count

Report.Name: Top Web Pages By Pages-Not-Found Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks the web servers and URLs by the page-not-found error count

Report.Name: Top Web Visitors By HTTP-Pages-Not-Found Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks web servers and visitors by HTTP page-not-found error count

Report.Name: Top Web Visitors By Unauthorized Access Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks web servers and visitors by the total number of unauthorized access error count

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_17
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("IIS-Web-Client-Error", "Apache-Web-Client-Error") AND httpStatusCode IN ("401", "403")

Report.Name: Top FTP Clients By Server side Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks web servers and their FTP clients by the total number of FTP errors

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_18
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND ftpStatusCode IN ("500", "501","503","504","550","552","553")

Report.Name: Top FTP Clients By Unauthorized Access Error Count
Report.Description: Ranks servers and their FTP clients by the total number of unauthorized Access Errors

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_19
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND ftpStatusCode IN ("503","550")

Report.Name: Top Web Visitors By Uncommon HTTP Method Count
Report.Description: Ranks Web servers and visitors by the total number of uncommon HTTP Methods

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_20
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpMethod NOT IN ("GET","POST")

Report.Name: Top Web Visitor Browser Types By Count
Report.Description: Ranks web servers and their client browser types by the total number of hits

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_21
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers and URLs By Average Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks Web Servers, URLs by average response time

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_22
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers By hits
Report.Description: Ranks Web servers by first the number of hits

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_23
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers By distinct visitors
Report.Description: Ranks Web servers by the number of distinct visitors

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_24
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers By bandwidth
Report.Description: Ranks Web servers by used bandwidth

SubPattern.name: Filter_WEB_SERVER_25
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_APP_WEB_SERVER) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitWebTraffic) AND httpStatusCode = "200"

Report.Name: Top Web Servers By STM Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks the services by average synthetic transaction monitoring probe response times.

Report.Name: Logon: Top Windows Servers, Users By Successful Logon Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers and their users by the number of successful logons. System accounts that end with $ or contain ANONYMOUS are excluded.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_1
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND user NOT CONTAIN "$" AND user NOT CONTAIN "ANONYMOUS"

Report.Name: Logon: Top Windows Users By Successful Logon Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers and their users by the number of successful logons. System accounts that end with $ or contain ANONYMOUS are excluded.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_1
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND user NOT CONTAIN "$" AND user NOT CONTAIN "ANONYMOUS"

Report.Name: Logon: Top Windows Servers,Users By Failed Logon Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers and their users by the number of failed logons

Report.Name: Logon: Windows Server Account Lockouts
Report.Description: This report captures account lockouts on windows servers. Account lockouts happen on repeated login failures and may be suspicious if they are repeated or happen at odd hours of operation

Report.Name: Change: Top Windows Servers, Users by Account Modification Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers and their administrative users by the number of user account modification events

Report.Name: Change: Windows Server Account Modification Details
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows account modification events. Details include the administrative user, target user, the operation performed and the raw log

Report.Name: Change: Windows File Access Details
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access events. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656")

Report.Name: Change: Top Windows Servers, Users By Config/Policy Modification Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers and their administrative users by the number of server configuration or policy modification events

Report.Name: All Events: Top Windows Reporting Servers By Event Count
Report.Description: This report ranks the windows servers by the total number of events sent

Report.Name: Change: Windows Server Config Modification Details
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server configuration or policy modification events. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_12
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_ConfigChange)

Report.Name: Change: Local User Accounts Created
Report.Description: This report captures user accounts added on a server

Report.Name: Change: Local User Accounts Deleted
Report.Description: This report captures user accounts removed from a server

Report.Name: Change: User Accounts Modified
Report.Description: This report captures local user account modifications.

Report.Name: Logon: Privileged Windows Server Logon Attempts using the Administrator Account
Report.Description: This report details prvileged logon attempts to a windows server using the Administrator account

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_29
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND user = "Administrator" AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)

Report.Name: Logon: Remote Desktop Connections to Windows Servers
Report.Description: This report details successful and failed remote desktop connections

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_30
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND winLogonType = 10 AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess)

Report.Name: Logon: Windows Server Successful Logons
Report.Description: This report captures all successful logons to windows servers.System accounts that end with $ or contain ANONYMOUS are excluded.

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_31
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess) AND user NOT CONTAIN "$" AND user NOT CONTAIN "ANONYMOUS"

Report.Name: Logon: Windows Server Failed Logons
Report.Description: This report captures all failed logons to windows servers

Report.Name: Change: Users Added To Local Windows Groups
Report.Description: This report captures users added to local groups.

Report.Description: This report captures users added to global or univeral groups.

Report.Name: Change: Users Deleted From Local Windows Groups
Report.Description: This report captures users deleted from local groups.

Report.Name: Change: Users Deleted From Global Groups
Report.Description: This report captures users deleted from global or univeral groups.

Report.Name: Change: Local Windows Groups Deleted
Report.Description: This report captures local group deletions

Report.Name: Change: Local Windows Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures local group modifications

Report.Name: Change: Global Windows Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures global group creations

Report.Name: Change: Global Windows Groups Deleted
Report.Description: This report captures global group deletions

Report.Name: Change: Global Windows Groups Modified
Report.Description: This report captures global group modifications

Report.Name: Change: Local Windows Groups Created
Report.Description: This report captures local group creations

Report.Name: Change: Windows Server Password Changes
Report.Description: Tracks password changes

Report.Name: Change: Windows Server Account Lock/Unlock history
Report.Description: Captures account lockouts and unlocks on windows servers. Account lockouts happen on repeated login failures and may be suspicious if they are repeated or happen at odd hours of operation.

Report.Name: Logon: Windows Server Account Unlocks
Report.Description: Captures account unlocks on windows servers. Account unlocks happen after lockouts that may happen on repeated login failures

Report.Name: Change: Windows Audit Policy Changed
Report.Description: This report captures audit policy changes

Report.Name: Performance: Top Windows Servers By CPU Util
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers by average cpu utilization over a window

Report.Name: Performance: Top Windows Servers By Memory Util and swap rate
Report.Description: Ranks the devices by average memory utilization and swap rate

Report.Name: Performance: Least Loaded Windows Servers By CPU Util
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers by average cpu utilization over a window

Report.Name: Performance: Top Windows Servers By Disk I/O Activity
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers by average disk I/O utilization over a window. This requires WMI.

Report.Name: Performance: Top Windows Servers By Disk Space Util
Report.Description: Ranks the devices by average system disk utilization over a window

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Hardware Errors
Report.Description: Captures Windows hardware warning and critical errors. Supported hardware includes Dell and HP

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Hardware Status
Report.Description: Captures windows hardware status. Supported hardware includes Dell and HP

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Ping Monitor Statistics
Report.Description: Tracks the PING response times and packet loss for the monitored devices

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Clean Shutdowns
Report.Description: Tracks windows server clean shutdowns

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Dirty Shutdowns
Report.Description: Tracks windows server dirty shutdown events

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Shutdowns and Restarts
Report.Description: Tracks windows server shutdown and restarts

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Application Down/Restart
Report.Description: Tracks application stop and start events

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_AVAIL_3
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppShutdown,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppRestart) AND (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) OR hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER))

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Interface Down/Up
Report.Description: Tracks server network interface down and up events

SubPattern.name: Filter_OVERALL_AVAIL_7
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NetIntfShutdown,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_NetIntfRestart) AND (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) OR hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER))

Report.Name: Availability: Top Windows Servers by Uptime
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers by system uptime

Report.Name: Availability: Top Windows Applications By synthetic transaction monitoring Response Time
Report.Description: Ranks the services by average synthetic transaction monitoring probe response times.

Report.Name: Availability: Top Windows Apps by Uptime
Report.Description: Ranks the windows applications (processes) by application uptime

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server TCP/UDP Ports Up/Down
Report.Description: Tracks TCP/UDP ports that went up or down in a server

Report.Name: Availability: Windows Server Processes Started/Stopped
Report.Description: Tracks started/stopped server processes

Report.Name: Change: Windows File Access Failures
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access failures. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 1

Report.Name: Change: Windows File Access Successes
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access successes. Details include the administrative user, file/directory, the operation performed and the raw log

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("Win-Security-560","Win-Security-564","Win-Security-4656") AND eventAction = 0

Report.Name: Top Windows Network Interfaces By 95th Pctile Traffic
Report.Description: Ranks the windows network interfaces by 95th percentile traffic

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

Report.Name: Performance: Top Windows servers by page file usage
Report.Description: Ranks the windows servers by average page file usage over a window

Report.Name: Top Windows Applications By CPU, Memory
Report.Description: Ranks Windows processes by first average cpu utilization and then by memory utilization

Report.Name: Windows Servers By Least Free Disk Space
Report.Description: Ranks windows servers by minimum free disk space over a window

SubPattern.name: Filter_PERF_MON_6
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot") AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER)

Report.Name: Change: Windows File Modification (via FortiSIEM Agent)
Report.Description: This report captures the details of windows server file access events detected via FortiSIEM Windows Agent.

Report.Name: Change: Windows Installed Software Changes (Via FortiSIEM Agent)
Report.Description: This report captures installed software changes detected via FortiSIEM Agent

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("AO-WUA-InstSw-Added","AO-WUA-InstSw-Removed")

Report.Name: Change: Windows Registry Changes (Via FortiSIEM Agent)
Report.Description: This report captures registry changes detected via FortiSIEM Agent

SubPattern.name: Filter_WINDOWS_8
SubPattern.SingleEvtConstr: reptDevIpAddr IN ( Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_WINDOWS_SERVER) AND eventType IN ("AO-WUA-Registry-Added","AO-WUA-Registry-Modified","AO-WUA-Registry-Removed")

Report.Name: Change: Windows File Content Changes (Via FortiSIEM Agent)
Report.Description: This report captures file content changes detected via FortiSIEM Agent

Report.Description: This report captures FortiSIEM Agent successful installs

Report.Description: This report captures file changes on USB drives inserted on Windows servers

Report.Description: This report captures removable media (CD/DVD/USB Drive) inserts on Windows servers

Report.Description: This report captures removable media (CD/DVD/USB Drive) ejects on Windows servers

If the MAC address is empty then, the event happened at the reporting Controller.
